summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding updating the victim website for the Ghislaine Maxwell case with information about an upcoming teleconference on jury selection. It includes proposed language for the public notice and a request to post the information.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: Addressed in an email requesting an update to the Maxwell victim website with information about an upcoming court teleconference.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case for which the victim website and court proceedings are being organized.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued an order regarding the teleconference on jury selection scheduled for October 21, 2021.

connections.description: M requests Nick to update the victim website with court information, indicating a working relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated by the order for a teleconference.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: The Court schedules a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, with public access via a provided audio feed.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office maintained a dedicated victim website for the Ghislaine Maxwell case to disseminate court information.
A teleconference on jury selection was scheduled for October 21, 2021, with provisions for public and press access via a live audio feed.
Judge Nathan issued an order regarding the teleconference, indicating ongoing pre-trial proceedings in the Maxwell case.
The correspondence shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office to manage public information related to the high-profile case.
